techmeme.title: A look at the 25-year-old CVE program, which assigns unique IDs to flaws; 413 orgs now report CVEs, with 40K+ reported in 2024, pushing the total past 270K (Cynthia Brumfield/CyberScoop)
A look at Apple's strategy missteps with TV+, including trying to rival Netflix by building a platform from scratch, using TV+ to boost device sales, and more (M.G. Siegler/Spyglass)

Alibaba releases Qwen2.5-VL-32B, a 32B open model under Apache 2.0, claims better alignment with human preferences and math reasoning than earlier 2.5 VL models (Simon Willison/Simon Willison's Weblog)
Some EU orgs weigh using Amazon, Google, and Microsoft cloud services over privacy fears under Trump; two European cloud providers say this is driving interest (Matt Burgess/Wired)
Alibaba Chairman Joe Tsai warns of a data center bubble, saying the buildout may outpace early AI demand and is starting to look indiscriminate (Luz Ding/Bloomberg)
